lifecycle.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles.

items.description: `lifecycle` can be used to customize the end-customer's experience when generating/uploading support bundles.

generate.description: Adds a step that will generate a support bundle. It has no arguments, but should be specified with an empty object `{}`

message.description: `message` can be used to print a message to the end customer.

examples: This process will collect a number of files from the host system to help you debug your problem
Thanks for uploading your bundle! SuperGoodTools will get back to you in 24 hours

upload.description: Adds a step in which the end customer can upload a bundle to https://console.replicated.com for review by the vendor.

prompt.description: Allows configuring an interactive prompt for the user to confirm before uploading

accept.description: A message to display if the user accepts the upload prompt
examples: Bundle uploaded! SuperGoodTool support will get back to you within 24 hours

decline.description: A message to display if the user declines the upload prompt
examples: Bundle was not uploaded, please send your bundle to SuperGoodTool support.

default.description: The default answer to the prompt

specs.description: A list of items to include in the support bundle.

items.description: A list of items to include in the support bundle.

description.description: A description of the file(s) that will be collected by this spec
examples: The contents of any files in /etc/supergoodtool/conf.d, with secrets redacted

docker.container-cp.description: Collect a file by copying from a running docker container

container.description: The name of the container to copy from

src_path.description: The path of the target file in the container's filesystem

docker.container-exec.description: Collect the stdout and stderr of `exec`-ing a command on a running docker container

container.description: The name of the container to run the command in

exec_config.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

AttachStderr.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

AttachStdin.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

AttachStdout.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

Cmd.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

items.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

Detach.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

DetachKeys.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

Env.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

items.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

Privileged.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

Tty.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

User.description: Same as would be passed to `docker exec`

docker.container-inspect.description: Collect the `docker inspect` output for one or more running or stopped containers

container_list_options.description: Options to be used to filter the list of containers

.*.description: Map of key-value pairs to filter on

Latest.description: Same as would be passed to `docker ps`

Limit.description: Same as would be passed to `docker ps`

Quiet.description: Same as would be passed to `docker ps`

Since.description: Same as would be passed to `docker ps`

Size.description: Same as would be passed to `docker ps`
